mainPage.mainText: MENTAL HEALTH AND PSYCHOSOCIAL SUPPORT ONLINE COURSE
mainPage.mainTextDesc: Learn about Mental health and psychosocial support (MHPSS), get general insight on mental health conditions and explore skills to provide mental health and psychosocial support

guarantee.adaptiveDesc: The course is designed for first-line professionals in Turkmenistan working with youth and women.
guarantee.relevanceDesc: Explore and build skills to provide MHPSS via a practical online course
guarantee.certificationDesc: Download certificate of completion upon successful completion of all stages

info.title: The aim of the online MHPSS course:
info.desc: To build capacities of helping professionals on providing community-based mental health and psychosocial support to vulnerable youth and women as a preventive measure.
info.courseFor: The course is designed to build capacities of frontline service providers, so that they can
info.courseFor1: understand the mental health continuum, mental health disorders and factors that impact mental health in the context of the lifespan approach;
info.courseFor2: understand the role of supporting individual mental health and well-being in preventing conflicts, strengthening social cohesion, and strengthening community resilience;
info.courseFor3: understand the MHPSS intervention pyramid and ability to match mental health services with the needs of vulnerable people, prioritising youth-at-risk and women at the community level;
info.courseFor4: identify signs of stress, trauma and other mental health conditions in individuals;
info.courseFor5: provide basic mental health and psychosocial support for individuals;
info.courseFor6: understand importance of doing referrals to specialized mental health and other services relevant to individual needs;
info.courseFor7: take care of one's mental health using evidence-based self-help tools and skills.
info.target1: Learn about mental health and its determinants;
info.target2: Build competencies in the area of mental health promotion, prevention, and support;
info.target3: Increase knowledge of evidence-based scalable mental health and psychosocial interventions;
info.target4: Develop skills to provide basic MHPSS.

test1.question: What is the definition of mental health according to the WHO?
test1.c: Ability to contribute to the community

test2.question: What is psychosocial suffering caused by?
test2.c: Interrelationship between psychological and social problems

test3.question: What is the goal of psychosocial support (PSS)?

test4.question: How can ongoing distress impact peacebuilding activities?
test4.a: It has no impact on peacebuilding
test4.d: It leads to immediate conflict resolution

test5.question: Why is addressing psychosocial suffering important in the context of peacebuilding?
test5.a: It has no relevance to peacebuilding
test5.c: It can prevent conflicts and violence

test6.question: What does the Mental Health Continuum represent?

test7.question: What are the three main groups of factors that impact mental health, according to the biopsychosocial approach?

test1.question: Which gender is associated with an increased risk of major depressive disorder?

test2.question: What does Layer 1 represent in the IASC MHPSS Pyramid?
test2.b: All people affected by the emergency

test3.question: What are the four kinds of interventions described in the WHO mhGAP Community Toolkit?
test3.a: Talking about mental health, physical therapy, social isolation, surgery
test3.b: Mental health promotion, self-help books, therapy animals, medical treatment
test3.c: Support for people with mental health conditions, medication, surgery, self-care
test3.d: Talking about mental health, mental health promotion and prevention, support for people with mental health conditions, recovery and rehabilitation

test4.question: According to WHO, what percentage of people with severe mental disorders receive no treatment for their mental health problem in low- and middle-income countries?

test5.question: Suicide is the _____ leading cause of death for 15-29-year-olds.

test6.question: According to the ICD-11, what are some of the common symptoms of Depression?
test6.a: Difficulty concentrating, feelings of worthlessness, and hopelessness
test6.c: Increased appetite, euphoria, and reduced energy

test7.question: What are the core characteristics of Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) as per ICD-11?
test7.a: Avoidance of activities reminiscent of the traumatic event
test7.b: Persistent perceptions of heightened current threat

test8.question: What type of emotions are often associated with re-experiencing the traumatic event in PTSD?

test1.question: What are the core WHO mhGAP communication skills for mental health and psychosocial support?
test1.b: Creating an environment that facilitates open communication

test2.question: How can you create an environment that facilitates open communication?
test2.a: Maintain eye contact and use body language that fosters trust
test2.b: Avoid introductions and keep conversations brief
test2.c: Always have a third party present during the conversation
test2.d: Use technical terms to demonstrate expertise

test3.question: Why is it important to involve the person with mental health issues in the discussion?
test3.a: It's not essential, and only their caregivers should be involved
test3.b: To make them feel more isolated
test3.d: To prevent them from speaking about their condition

test4.question: How should you approach communication with children when using language they can understand?
test4.a: Ask them complex questions to test their comprehension
test4.c: Use language related to their interests and experiences
test4.d: Speak to them using technical terminology

test5.question: Why is it essential to be nonjudgmental when interacting with individuals with mental health conditions?
test5.b: To create a tense and judgmental atmosphere

test6.question: What is the main goal of Psychosocial Support Step 1: Recognition and Establishing Communication?
test6.c: To see the signs of distress and initiate the conversation

test1.question: In Psychosocial Support Step 2, Validation, what message does the person receive about their mental health condition?
test1.a: It is imaginary and something to be afraid to talk about
test1.b: It's not a valid condition, and they are alone in their experience
test1.c: It is real, valid, and there is someone they can talk to without judgment
test1.d: It's their fault that they have a mental health condition

test2.question: What is the main focus of Psychosocial Support Step 3: Delivery of Psychosocial Support?
test2.a: Referring the person to specialized services
test2.b: Providing medication for the person's condition

test3.question: What is the primary purpose of Psychosocial Support Step 4: Referral to Specialized Services?
test3.b: To refer the person to a psychiatrist for medication
test3.c: To make a referral to a specialist in case of need
test3.d: To discourage people from seeking specialized services

test1.question: What is the main task of Psychosocial Support Step 5: Follow-Up?
test1.b: Ensure that support was not received
test1.c: Initiate a re-meeting, check progress, and repeat referrals if necessary
test1.d: Determine if a person's mental health condition has improved
